Literature Review: Biologging and biotelemetry have revolutionized the field of marine animal research, providing unprecedented insights into the lives and environments of marine animals. The use of miniaturized sensors has enabled scientists to collect rich data on individual and group behavior, internal states, and the surrounding environment of free-ranging animals. This literature review aims to summarize the history of technologies used to track marine animals, identify seven major research categories of marine biologging and biotelemetry, and discuss significant achievements and future opportunities.
